text: It's a bitter cold January morning. The woods are quiet. Desolate. In the far off distance a man is jogging. He ba around the end of a small pond and runs right at us. This MIKE FLAHERTY, FORTY-TWO. He is running hard. Or at least hard as he can.
Suddenly TWO JOGGERS blow past him.
A HOME MADE STAIN GLASS ANGEL hangs on a window. It falls the ground.
ABBY FLAHERTY, SIX-YEARS OLD, stirs and gets out of her b out. She picks up the Bird and inspects it. It's broken.
Shit.
JACKIE FLAHERTY, THIRTY-SEVEN is still sleeping. Abby wal into the room. Jackie opens her eyes.
Mommy, can we play croquet today?
Jackie lifts Abby onto the bed.
Where's Daddy?
He's running.
From what?
Jackie smiles.
STELLA, TWO YEARS OLD is standing up in her crib crying. comes in and picks her up.
OK. OK. Hi there.
Jackie prepares some food. She knocks a glass over into t sink and it breaks.
Shit.
She looks over at Abby who is immersed in her coloring. T she sets the food down in front of Stella who is sitting high chair. Mike enters wearing a suit and tie.
How was the run?
Good. It was good. Abby, finish your cereal.
I'm very impressed with you keeping it up.
Mike shrugs and takes a yogurt from the refrigerator.
I don't like it.
You do too, so stop drawing and eat.
What brand is this? Daddy, look. It's your team.
They're all the same.
Mike looks at the drawing. It looks nothing like a team.
That's my team? That's great, honey. Are they winning?
Yeah.
Maybe you should show the team.
Abby knocks over a glass of water. It spills onto the drawing.
Shit.
Honey, you can't use that word. It's a bad word.
Off Mike's look.
What? Don't look at me.
Uh huh. Bye sweetie.
He kisses Abby.
Bye daddy. Bye.
Hey. You OK?
Yeah.
You sure?
Yeah. I'm good. Why?
Just checking.
OK. Bye guy's.
Can I have more juice?
Mike leaves. Jackie is not convinced.
Just a minute.
Mike walks outside toward his car. He opens the car door.
Mike?
Mike turns. Jackie is standing at the door.
Did you call Fenn about the tree?
No. I will today.
Please do. I don't want it coming down on the house.
Mike looks at a VERY DEAD TREE in the side yard.
Yeah. You're right. I will.
Mike?
Yeah?
I love you.
I love you too, sweetie. Bye.
Jackie shuts the door. Mike looks up at the tree.
Shit.

Mike pays for his coffee and bagel and starts to leave. H nods to a group of FIVE OLD MEN who wave him over. He tri to keep moving but they continue to engage him. Finally h joins the table. The group shares a laugh.
Mike's car pulls into a driveway of an OLD HOUSE that has been converted into TWO OFFICES.
A SIGN on the lawn reads: "MICHAEL S. FLAHERTY, COUNSELOR LAW" and "STEPHEN VIGMAN, CPA"
Mike parks his car as a WORKMAN walks up from the basemen the house and gets into his VAN and pulls away.
Mike gets out of his car and walks toward the back door carrying his briefcase. He stops at the basement steps.
Vig?
Down here.
Mike walks down the stairs.
It's an old, musty basement filled with endless shelves o files.
What's up, Vig?
Donna's out sick and can't find anything without her. It sucks.
STEPHEN VIGMAN, FIFTY, emerges carrying some files.
Who was that guy?
Oh, that sucks more. He's the plumber. I called him to look at that piece of crap of boiler.
Vigman points to an ANCIENT HOT WATER BOILER.
Why?
That clanking is driving me nuts. Can't you hear it down in your office?
Yeah. I just figured it's old.
Well it is but he took one look at it and said we should replace it before it blows.
What?! We just had it fixed three months ago.
Yeah, he said that job was crap. The guy did crap work. Can you believe that? That little scumbag!
Jesus. All they care about is getting paid. Makes me sick. No one wants to do the work anymore.
How much to fix it, Vig? Did he say?
Six grand to replace everything.
Holy shit.
Tell me about it. I gotta be honest, Mike, it's not a good time for me. My business is off and my step son wants to get Lasik.
Really? Isn't he too young?
I don't really care at this point. If it makes him happy, he can have it. I get nothing from that kid.
Nothing. He has an unnatural attachment to his father.
Right. So what do you want to do?
Well I was thinking we could leave it for now and just cover the file cabinets in plastic to be safe. How about you?
Yeah. I guess I'm good with that.
CLANK. CLANK. CLANK. The boiler barks. They both jump.
Let's get out of here before it blows. I'll pick some up plastic before practice.
They both hurry back up the stairs.
Mike walks into his office. SHELLY, the receptionist, is her computer working. She's mid-20s and pure Jersey.
Hey Shelly, How you doing?
I'm a little hung over and my boyfriend's a moron.
Oh. Sorry to hear that.
How'd the team do last night?
We lost.
Bummer. Your noon canceled so you just have a 10:30 and 3pm.
OK. Anything else?
The toilet isn't flushing again. Should I just call someone this time?
No. I'll take a look at it. Who do I have at ten-thirty?
Frank.
Great.
Mike is sitting with FRANK, an elderly man, jotting notes
And you think your son stole it?
Yeah. I know he did.
Why would he steal your cat, Frank?
He's jealous of her. Very jealous.
Mike is on his phone as he cleans his keyboard.
I understand but that's my fee for that particular service. Uh huh. Right. Well maybe I can adjust that a little bit.
Mike is eating lunch at his desk. He hears a noise and lo out the back window and see's Vigman pulling a LARGE ROLL PLASTIC TARP out of the trunk of his car.
Mike, on his knees, plunges the broken toilet.
Mike is sitting with LEO POPLAR, 82 and his HOME HEALTH A JOLIE, FORTY-FIVE and AFRICAN AMERICAN.
Well Leo, remember you got lost and the police had to help you a few times. That's why we brought Jolie into help you, right?
So now what happens?
Well if that Judge deems you incapacitated then you will need a guardian. And if we can't find your daughter then the state...
She can't find herself.
OK but if we can't find her then the State will have to become your guardian.
Who's the state?
You know...the state...of New Jersey.
That's crazy. I don't need New Jersey's help. I got Jolie now. And there's no funny business between us so you know.
Right. I'm sure there's not. Let's just first see if we can find your daughter and then we'll go from there.
SHELLY flips through some DOCUMENTS. The boiler sounds of CLANK CLANK CLANK. She jumps. She picks up the documents walks into Mike's office setting the documents down.
Am I still hung over or is that noise getting louder?
You're probably still hung over. What's that?
Leo's financial statements. He's loaded, huh?
Yes, he is. You find his daughter?
No. That lady is gone and doesn't want to be found.
Crap.
Mike takes the STATEMENTS and puts them in LEO'S FILE.
Can't the state just leave him in his home? That's what the guy wants.
They could but they never will. It's too much work. They'll probably move him into Oak Knoll. Hand me one of their brochures?
Shelly grabs an OAK KNOLL BROCHURE from a stack.
But he has Jolie now. She can handle it.
No, she can't. His guardian still has to make every single decision. It's the difference between a baby sitter and a parent.
She hands it to Mike who takes it and paper clips in on t inside of Leo's file.
I wish I could do it. I could use an extra 1,500 bucks a month.
$1,500. Is that what it is?
Yeah. It's in his file. (Answering the phone) Mike Flaherty's office.
Mike opens Leo's file.

location: NEW PROVIDENCE HIGHSCHOOL GYM, THE PIT

text: Mike and Vigman are coaching wrestling practice at the pu highschool. They are in the small, dingy back gym just of the main gymnasium. This is a no-frills program.
The team of 12 WRESTLERS are doing a spinning drill. Vigm holds up a singlet.
Whose singlet is this? What did I say about leaving them around?
A WRESTLER runs over and Vig flings it at him.
Mike and TERRY DELFINO are running. Terry is the same age Mike but dressed in a better gear. They are both breathin hard.
How's the team doing?
Not good.
What the hell happened? We used to be good.
Yeah, well we're not anymore.
Can we walk for a bit?
Yeah.
They both stop. Terry is completely winded.
That sucked. You're running good, buddy. Kicking my ass.
Terry's blackberry beeps. He takes it out and reads it.
Yeah. I've been getting out here a bit more often.
You gotta be kidding me.
What?
Lori's texting me at seven in the morning to ask me if I want an antique sewing table that we bought together.
Do you?
No. I want my fucking house back!
Is she still with that guy?
You mean my contractor? The guy I hired? Yeah, she is. I can just picture that little scumbag walking around my house wearing his tool belt. Here.
He hands Mike his blackberry.
Take a picture for me.
Terry pulls down his pants and moons Mike.
Take it! Jesus, Ter!
Hurry! It's cold.
Mike takes the picture. Terry takes the blackberry back.
Don't send it.
Too late. I hate her.
They start to walk.
Maybe you should move back into the city? Get a new job. Shake it up a bit.
Nah. Finley called me. He's starting up a new fund out here in May so I'm gonna wait for that.
That guy's starting another fund?
Yeah. He's an animal. He prints money. Come on, let's finish strong.
Terry starts to run. Mike follows. After about thirty fee Mike pulls up. He's breathing is labored.
Hold up!
What?
Just...hold up.
Mike is really breathing hard now. He's making some funny noises.
You alright?
Mike just holds up a hand. He can't really speak.
Mike, what the fuck? What's (Barely audible) wrong? Yeah. Fine. I just...
He drops to a knee. He's not alright.
Holy fuck! Mike? Hang on pal.
Terry takes out his black berry but immediately fumbles i into the wet mud.
Fuck! Fuck!
He grabs it and shakes it out but it's dead.
You gotta be kidding me. Shit.
Mike is still wheezing. Terry turns his attention.
Is it your heart, buddy? Are you having a heart attack?
No! I'm not having a heart attack! I just...can't breathe...
That could be a heart attack, Mike. You should lie down.
Terry tries to help him but it's only seems to annoy Mike
Get off me! Just lie down.
No! It's wet. I don't want to lie down.
Who cares? You might be dying. Are you cold? Do you feel cold?
Yeah. I'm lying on the ground.
Look into my eyes, Mike. Look into my eyes.
They are now engaged in a weird wrestling match.
Are you alright?
Terry looks to see TWO FORTY YEAR OLD WOMEN in jogging ge staring at them.
An ambulance pulls away revealing Mike and Terry sitting the open back of Terry's LEXUS SUV.
OK dude, how long has that been happening?
Couple of months. The doctor says it's stress.
Seriously? Did he prescribe anything for you?
Yeah. Jogging. Why the hell you think I'm doing this?
Jesus. That scared the shit out of me. What are you so stressed about, Mike?
I don't know. Work. Money. Everything.
Is it that bad?
Yeah. It is. I don't know how much longer I can keep my practice going.
Really? Holy shit, Mike! What're you gonna do?
I have no frickin' idea. I've been trying everything.
Have you told Jackie?
Not yet. I don't want to freak her out.
Good call. So we just need a new strategy, that's all. What about that Judge that's always throwing work your way? Can't she help you out?
Judge Lee, yeah. If it wasn't for her I'd probably be out of business already. I just need more.
Is there anything else you can do for money?
What the hell am I gonna do? Bartend? I'm a lawyer, Ter. I practice law.
And it's not like I'm some I know. scumbag. I help old people for Christ sake. No offense but your pal, Finley doesn't give a crap about anything but making money.
Yeah. But that's why he makes it.
No shit, Ter. Thanks for the update.
The office is dark aside from Mike's desk light. Shelly i gone. Mike's blackberry rings.
Hi, honey. I'm still at the office. Yeah. I came back after practice, I'll be home in a bit. (Checking his blackberry) Oh, hey, let me go, Jack. I've been waiting for this call. Bye.
Mike hangs up the phone and answers his blackberry.
Hey Tom. Thanks for getting back to me. I'm good. I'm good. Yeah, I was just following up to see if you had any overflow. It's been a slow month on this end and I was...
Mike listens. The news from Dunleavy isn't good.
Oh. OK. No, yeah of course. I appreciate that. Thanks, Tom. Bye.

Mike hangs up the phone and sits at his desk. After a mom he slams his hand on the desk. And then something catches eye. It's LEO POPLAR'S FILE. He opens the file and see's PAMPHLET FOR OAK KNOLL. He flips through the file and lan on a particular page and a particular line item.
Monthly Commission: $1,508.00.
Mike walks with Leo Poplar up the steps of the courthouse

location: UNION COUNTY COURT HOUSE , SECURITY DESK

text: Leo walks through the metal detector. Mike watches him an then walks through himself but something beeps. The guard stops Mike. Leo starts to wander away.
Hey, Leo. Leo hold on! (to the Guard) Can you stop him, please?
It's a very drab, no frills courtroom. JUDGE LEE is seate the bench looking over some documents.
Mike is sitting next Leo. Seated at the next table is STU THATCHER, ATTORNEY FOR THE OFFICE OF PUBLIC GUARDIAN. Mik tapping his pen.
Any word from his daughter? Mr. Flaherty?
Oh..no, Your Honor. I have the two certified letters returned unclaimed. And there is no phone number for her. We can't find her.
And she is the only living family, is that correct?
Yes, your Honor, she is. But Mr. Poplar hasn't seen her for over twenty years.
Who?
Your daughter.
She's late? She's probably at the store buying some crap or something.
Mike turns back to the Judge and shrugs.

OK, then as, Mr. Poplar has been deemed incapacitated by this court, I'm appointing the Office of Public Guardian to serve as the guardian for his person and property. Do you have the order for me to sign, Mr. Thatcher?
Yes, I do, Your Honor.
Then please approach.
Thatcher stands and takes out the order. Mike's wheels ar spinning. He seizes his moment.
Your Honor, if it pleases the Court.
Yes, Mr. Flaherty?
I would be willing to serve as Mr. Poplar's guardian.
(Stopping.) Really?
Yeah.
How long have you known him? Two weeks?
Mike is suddenly put on the spot.
More like five.
Really? And now you want to be his guardian?
Mike looks at Leo and the Judge.
May I approach, your honor?
Council approach.
Mike collects himself and approaches.
What's going on Mike?
Well Judge, I think I'd be a better candidate then the state in this case.
Really?
Yeah, and stop saying really, it's annoying.
THE STENOGRAPHER raises in eyebrow.
Your Honor, I live in the Proximity hardly qualifies same town as Mr. Poplar... him as a guardian, Your Honor.
And, as his lawyer, I feel like I'm in a better position to execute what my client wants.
Your Honor, Mr. Flaherty is Mr. Poplar's court appointed attorney...
I know, Stu, I appointed him.
Yeah, well that hardly qualifies him to be Leo's Guardian. What's the motivation here?
Thatcher is turning up the heat. He obviously wants Popla Mike is starting to feel it.
Mike?
Mike looks back at Leo who is trying to unscrew the cap o his water bottle, completely uninterested in the proceedi He makes a decision.
Your Honor, Leo told me he wants to live at home. He has the money to do that and I want to make sure that happens. If the State can do that then fine.
Counsel knows we can't do that, your Honor.
We're spread too thin for that kind of individual attention. But they have an excellent elder care facility in Mr. Poplar's town. We'll put him there.
Mr. Poplar wants to live at home.
You can do that, Mike?
Yes, I can.
Really.
Leo is putting papers in his briefcase. Mike sits down ne to him.
Did we win?
Yeah. I think so.
Good.
Mike walks toward his car carrying AN OLD TV SET. He puts into the back of his car which is packed with ITEMS from Leo's house.
Mike and Leo are driving.
Are we going to the park?
No. We're not, Leo. I'm gonna help you get settled into a new place to live right here in town.
I don't need a new place. I have a house. I'm not fancy that way.
I know. But I need you to stay in this new place for a while. It's nice. You'll like it.
Is that what the judge said?
Yeah, that's what he said.
Leo considers the news and looks out the window.
Ah shit.
Mike and Leo arrive at Oak Knoll.

text: It is a nice place. Mike sits on a small couch filling ou paperwork as a FEMALE STAFF MEMBER helps to prepare Leo's room.

Mike pulls up and walks into the Convenience Store. He bu cigarettes and walks outside. He walks outside, around th corner and then behind the store. He lights a cigarette a then throws the pack into the dumpster. He stands there smoking.

location: OUR LADY OF PEACE CHURCH- MORNING.

text: AN ENORMOUS CRUCIFIX hangs over the alter. A COLLECTION BASKET is passed from person to person. Abby deposits TWO DOLLARS into the basket and looks up at Mike. He smiles.

Jackie and Stella are waiting in the parking lot. Mike is lagging behind carrying Abby and chatting with some OLDER PARISHIONER'S. He's charming and he's working it. He fina catches up with Jackie and they walk toward the car.
Let's go, Mr. Mayor. It's cold and I need to pick up some bagels for your mom's.
OK. OK. I just have to make one stop first.
Where?
I have to swing by a client's house and shut off the water.
Why?
Because it's freezing and I don't want his pipes to burst.
No, I mean why are you doing it?
What? Oh, because I'm his guardian.
What? Since when?
Just last week. Mommy, I want a bagel.
That's a big deal, Mike. Were you even gonna tell me?
It's not a big deal. And yes, It is too. I was gonna tell you.
You don't have time to be taking care of some old man.
Jack, he's in Oak Knoll. They do everything. I just have to check in on him from time to time.
And who pays for that?
He does. It comes out of his estate and he can afford it. Trust me.
I don't get it. You've never done it before.
No I haven't.
So why are you doing it now?
It's just...the right thing to do, alright. We couldn't find his daughter and I'm just trying to help the guy. It's really not a big deal.
Well, it sounds like a big deal. And you should have told me.
What's a big deal?
Ask your daddy, sweetie. Maybe he'll tell you.
Daddy, what's a big deal?
Mike pulls up to Leo's house. It's a small house in a wor class section of town. A TEENAGER is sitting on the front stoop.
Is that his house?
Yeah.
(Re: the Young Man) Who's that?
No idea.
Mike gets out of the car.
Mike walks up the front walk. The YOUNG MAN is listening his Ipod and smoking a cigarette. Mike approaches and wav The YOUNG MAN removes his headphones. He has a BRUISE on left eye.
How you doing? Can I help you?
No.
Are you looking for Mr. Poplar?
Yeah.
Well, he doesn't live here anymore.
Where does he live?
You mind telling me why you're looking for him first?
The Young Man sizes Mike up. Then...
He's my Grandfather. I came to live with him.
Mike is momentarily stunned by the news. Then he looks ba at the car where Jackie gives him a "What's going on?" lo Uh oh.
Mike is driving. The Young Man is in the back seat next t Abby and Stella.
So do you live around here, Kyle?
No. Ohio.
Jackie looks at Mike who tries to avoid her piercing gaze
Ohio? And where are your parents?
It's just my mother and me. She's back in Columbus. She couldn't come.
So how did you get here?
Bus.
Really? All by yourself?
Yeah.
Wow.
That sounds like a big deal.
Jackie looks at Mike. From the mouths of babes.
Mike knocks on Leo's door. After a moment, Leo opens it.
Hey, Leo, you have a visitor.
Who? Him?
Yeah.
Hi.
Come on in. I'll turn off the TV.

location: OAK KNOLL SENIOR LIVING, LEO'S ROOM

text: Leo turns off the TV and then turns and looks at Kyle. He doesn't recognize him.
This is Kyle Timmons, Leo. He's your grandson. He came from Ohio to see you.
I don't have a Grandson.
Yeah, you do. We just never met.
Are you bringing me home?
Kyle looks to Mike, unsure of what to say.
Kyle's just here for a visit, Leo.
Oh. You want to watch TV?
Leo turns on the TV and sits down. Kyle joins him.
OK. So I'll come back to pick you up in an hour. You OK?
Yeah.
You alright, Leo? (Leo doesn't respond) OK, see you in a bit.

The house is smaller than Mike's house. GINA, MIKE'S MOTH and Jackie clean up after breakfast. Mike sits with Abby the kitchen table.
So did you call his mother?
No. Not yet. Oh and he was smoking too. He's sixteen!
He's probably on drugs.
I know.
What are you going to do with him?
We're going to send him back is what we're going to do.
Well I hope so. You have your hands full over there. And now taking care of that old man too. That sounds like a lot, Mike.
Thank you, Gina. I agree. He somehow forgot to tell me about it.
I told you.
Not until I asked.
His daughter should be taking care of him. Not you. You have me to worry about.
I don't have to worry about him. He's at Oak Knoll.
Daddy? Can we play croquet today?
The whole thing just sounds crazy.
It is crazy. It's crazy.
Who's crazy?
Me.
Mike and Kyle exit he building and walk toward the parkin lot.
How did the visit go?
OK. He fell asleep watching TV. So he lives there now?
Yeah. Your grandfather is in the early stages of dementia, Kyle. So sometimes he does things and says things that don't make sense.
Are you a friend of his or something?
I'm his guardian.
What's that mean?
It means I make sure he's well taken care of.
That's cool.
Kyle lights a cigarette.
Kyle's is fiddling with KID'S KEYBOARD. Jackie walks downstairs.
Everything alright?
Yeah.
Did you reach your mom?
Yeah. I told her I was coming home.
Did she want to talk to me or anything?
No.
Well, I'm sorry you can't stay longer but maybe you can come back with your mom and visit again.
Yeah. If I want to smoke should I go outside?
You shouldn't be smoking.
I know. But if I do.
Jackie decides not to engage.
Yeah. You should go outside.
OK. Good night, Jackie.
Good night, Kyle.

Mike is leaning against the counter eating ice cream. Jac emerges from the stairs, shuts basement door behind her a slides a dead bolt locking it.
What are you doing?
We have kids, Mike. I'm not taking any chances with Eminem down there.
There's not even a bathroom down there.
Jackie thinks about this and then unlocks the door in a h and walks up stairs.

location: OAK KNOLL SENIOR LIVING, DINING ROOM

text: Mike and Kyle are sitting with Leo who is eating breakfas
Hey Mike, could you talk to them about getting Coco Puffs? I like that kind.
Sure thing, Leo.
Mike's a stand up guy. You need cereal then talk to him.
Kyle and Mike smile. Mike checks his watch.
We should go, Kyle.
OK. Bye Leo.
Are you going to work?
No. I'm going home.
Well, don't take any shit from any of those guys.
Kyle smiles. He doesn't always understand this guy but he likes him.
I won't.

Mike and Kyle are waiting for the bus. Mike pulls out his wallet.
Here's fifty bucks in case you need it.
Mike counts his cash.
I have money.
Actually it's only forty-three but take it. You never know.
I have enough money. But thanks.
The bus pulls up.
Well, good luck, Kyle.
Yeah. You too, Mike.
Kyle gets on the bus. Mike watches it pull away.
Mike and Jackie are sleeping. The phone rings and Mike answers the phone.
Hello? Yes, it is. Yes. OK.
Jackie sits up and turns on the light.
OK. Thanks. I'll be right down.
He hangs up the phone.
What?
It was the police. They have Kyle.

Breaking and entering.
Mike gets up.
What?
Mike and Kyle walk out of the New Providence Police Stati
So what happened?
I decided not to go home.
And then you decided you'd break into your Grandfather's house?
You mind if I have a quick smoke?
Yeah, I do. Get in the car.
Kyle fastens his seat belt.
So you want to tell me what happened?
Not really.
Yeah. Well good luck with that, pal.
Kyle looks at Mike.
You'll see.
Jackie is waiting. Kyle is on the hot seat. Mike is watch
Kyle?
Kyle can barely look at her.
We can't help you if you don't tell us what's going on. Is there a reason you don't want to go home?
Kyle remains silent.
What happened to your eye, Kyle?
Kyle shifts. Avoiding.
Kyle. You can trust us.
Kyle looks up at them. Trust is obviously an issue.
I can't live there anymore.
With your Mom? Did she do that to your eye?
No. She's not even there. She's in a clinic or hospital or whatever. I'm living with Craig.
Who's Craig?
Her boyfriend, I guess, but he's an asshole.
Does she even know you're here?
My mom? She doesn't care about me.
How do you know? She's probably worried sick and just doesn't know how to reach you.
Kyle reaches into his pocket and takes out his cell phone
She could've called, right?
The sincerity of his question is heartbreaking and Jackie cut to the quick. She looks at Mike. Brutal.
Kyle is sitting on the back steps and smoking a cigarette
Mike is sitting up in bed. His wheels are spinning.
We don't have a choice now.
So what are we gonna do? Adopt him?
Jackie walks into the room putting on face moisturizer.
No. But I'm not sending him back until I talk to his mother. She better freaking call me back.
Honey, I know it's tough but we're not in a position to take care of another kid right now.
She gets in the bed.
I don't care. I'm not sending him back there, Mike. I can't. And for the record, I'm not very happy about it either!
Then we don't have to do this.
Yes, we do, Mike! We do. It makes me so angry and so damn sad to see that poor kid in that kind of situation. He's just a kid.
Jackie starts to break. Mike buckles.
I know. I know. You're right.
I just want to go to Ohio and...beat the crap out of his mom.
Come on.
I do. I want to beat the crap out of her and her stupid boyfriend.
I'm serious.
I know. I'm just not sure that beating the crap out of everybody is the best solution.
Well it feels like it. I'm leaving her another message.

Now?
Yes. Now. Shush!
Terry is sitting in his parked car, talking on his cell.
So get rid of him again.
Terry watches as a PICK UP TRUCK pulls into a beautiful country house.
I can't. Not until we figure what's going on back there.
Have you talked to his mother?
No. Not yet. Jack's left her about thirty messages.
A STRAPPING CONTRACTOR wearing a TOOL BELT gets out and w into the house.
Mother fucker. He's wearing his tool belt.
What? Who?
No. Sorry dude, I was distracted.
Where are you? Are you watching Lori's house again?
Terry quickly pulls out.
It's my fucking house and no. I'm just driving. Where's the kid now?
Mike is sitting at his desk.
He's sitting in my waiting room. Jackie made me take him with me.
Alright, listen pal, this is not the time to long that stock, you know what I mean?
No. What does that mean?
It means you shouldn't be taking care of another kid. Especially a convict.
Yeah, well...
Shelly pops her head in.
I found her.
Mike spins in his chair.
Let me call you back.
Fine. But get rid of the convict, Mike!
Mike hangs up.
She's in a drug treatment program in Columbus. She has five weeks to go.
Jesus. Can I talk to her?
They said she would call you.
Mike shakes his head. Nothing is easy here.
He's kind of a sweet kid but what's up with hair?
Who knows?
A knock on the door.
Yeah.
Kyle opens it.
Can I go visit Leo?
Mike looks to Shelly who just shrugs.
Uh...yeah...OK. You know where it is?
Yeah. Just down the street.
OK, yeah. Just stay there and I'll pick you up at about three.
Kyle shuts the door. Mike looks at Shelly.
That's some crazy hair, I'm just saying.

location: NEW PROVIDENCE HIGHSCHOOL GYM, THE PIT

text: Kyle is sitting in the corner watching. Mike is standing watching. He doesn't like what he sees.
Hey, Rew, what are you doing? Coach, can you get on Pill.
Get up, Rew.
REW gets up and Vigman gets down on the other wrestler, P
Everyone watch because none of you are doing it right. You want to put your chest into his side.
Vig does it but he's a bit off.
Just slide back a bit, Vig. A bit more. Yeah. Right there. Then you give him your full weight. Go ahead Vig.
Vig does. Pill starts to buckle. Vig is big.
Then you ride the crotch and break him down with a cross-face.
Vigman grabs Pill under the crotch, applies a stiff cross face and then drives him hard to the mat. Another Wrestle STEMLER chimes in. Stemler is wearing a STAR WARS t-shirt
Oh man, how'd that feel, Pill? We'll just call you "pancake"!
Stemler's a bit off.
Shut up, Chewbaka.
Yeah, right. More like the "Secret Apprentice".
What are you, ten years old, Stemler?
Mike loses it.
Hey! We're trying to teach you guys something and you're all just goofing off. Shut up!
Quiet!
Last time I checked we haven't won a match! Right coach?!
It's embarrassing, guys.
It's embarrassing. But you're all acting like you don't care! Well, I'm not getting paid enough to just jerk around here. (gestures to Vig) I don't know about you?
I'm not getting paid enough.
I care about what I do and so should you!
I care!
So does coach Vig, and so should you! Run em, Coach. I can't look at them anymore!
Let's go ladies!
Mike storms out past Kyle who watches him go.

location: MIKE AND JACKIE'S HOUSE, DINING ROOM

text: Mike, Jackie, Abby and Kyle are eating dinner together. A is coloring. Mike watches Kyle as he finishes his big gla of milk.
Here, have some more corn.
She gives him the bowl of corn.
I'll get you some more milk too.
Kyle finishes off the corn. Jackie gets up for the milk.
Did you call Fenn about the tree, Mike?
Uh...yeah I did but Terry said he'd help and I think we can...
Mike. Don't start. You two are not cutting down that tree. Just call Fenn.
Stella starts to cry on the BABY MONITOR.
I'm going to give her some Tylenol.
And Jackie is gone.
Do you want to play croquet?
Now?
When it's warm.
Yeah, maybe.
Mike gets up and begins to load the dishwasher.
Daddy, can I watch TV?
Uh...yeah but just for a half hour.
Abby leaves. Kyle turns to Mike.
Hey Mike, you think I could practice with you guys tomorrow?
Yeah, if you want. Sure. And by the way, what I did in there today, yelling like that. I don't usually do that.
You were right, they deserved it.

location: NEW PROVIDENCE HIGH SCHOOL, BACK GYM

text: Mike and Kyle are walking into the gym.
I don't have wrestling shoes.
Don't worry about it. You ever wrestle before?
Yeah.
Vigman is already running the team through a drill.
Get that ankle. Get that ankle! Time!
Hey Vig. Alright, guys, listen up! Kyle's going to be working out with us for a little while.
What's up Kyle!
The team laughs. Kyle just nods to Stemler.
Carlos, you and Jimmy rotate him in.
Kyle nods and walks over to Carlos and Jimmy.
OK. Let's go. Ten seconds to get an ankle. Then we switch it up. Ready? Wrestle!
Jimmy sits against the wall and Mike blows his whistle ag the wrestlers all go at each other. Mike watches Kyle.
He moves well. Fluidly. Carlos keeps trying to grab Kyle' ankle but Kyle easily defends against it. Mike checks his watch. Then blows his whistle.
Time. Switch. And...wrestle!
Mike blows his whistle again and Kyle goes on the offensi He gives Carlos a quick head fake and before Carlos knows what's happened, Kyle has grabbed his ankle and tripped h down to the mat.
Carlos looks shocked. Kyle pops back up but stays focused Carlos. Mike looks to Vigman who raises an eyebrow, impressed. One thing is certain, Kyle can wrestle.

location: NEW PROVIDENCE HIGH SCHOOL PARKING LOT

text: Kyle and Mike are walking toward the car.
You have fun?
Yeah.
When's the last time you wrestled?
A couple years ago.
Why'd you stop?
Just felt like it.
Kyle just shrugs and Mike let's it go. They arrive at Mik car and Mike talks to Kyle over the roof.
So let me ask you something, Kyle. How good are you?
Kyle just looks at Mike, almost blank.
I'm pretty good.

location: MIKE AND JACKIE'S HOUSE, MIKE'S OFFICE NOOK

text: Mike is looking at his computer screen.
Holy shit.
Mike runs inside. It's a sparsely furnished bachelor pad all the toys.
You check out that link I sent you?
Yeah. Kyle Timmons. That's the kid?
Yeah. That's the kid!
Holy shit!
I know, right? Can you believe that?!
Terry is in the den at his computer, reading excitedly.
Holy shit! He was thirty-five and one as a freshman!
I know. He finished second at the states. In Ohio!
Mike walks into the kitchen and grabs a beer.
This kid had seventeen pins. He's a killer.
I know. It's nuts. And he quit after his freshman year.
Why?
I don't know. He doesn't talk much. He's kind of a weird kid. Why can't I have one kid like that on my team? Just one.
What're you talking about? You do. You have him. You can take this kid to the states, Mike.
He's not on the team, Ter. He's not even a student. He's been here for three days.
So what? Enroll him!
I'm not enrolling him. He's just here until we reach his mother and figure this out.
So he's gotta do something, right? Let him wrestle. Look at this way, you're helping out the old man and this kid's a little bonus for doing the right thing.
I'm not just helping out the old man, Ter. It's not like it's charity work. I'm getting paid for it.
No. Shit, everyone gets paid, but think about it, Mike. What are the chances that this kid ends up on your door step and he can wrestle like that? It's a sign, pal.
This lands with Mike. Terry sits down at his computer.
Check this out. There's a video link of him wrestling in some tournament.
Terry presses play. It's grainy and amateur but good enou Mike looks on.
Look at that kid.
Mike gets sucked in.
Wow. He's gonna throw him. Look, he's setting him up. He's setting him up!
Mike and Terry explode. They high five and hug.
Kyle is standing, waiting. Jackie walks out with her purs
Here's five dollars for lunch. I have no idea what it costs but let me know when you find out.
I have money.
Good for you. Save it. Now take this, it's too early to argue.
Kyle takes it. Mike arrives.
OK. Let's go, pal.
Bye Jackie.
Kyle leaves. Mike kisses Jackie.
Hey, you sure we should do this?
Why not? Whether he's here for two more days or two weeks it gives him something to do all day. Unless you want him hanging out here?
OK. Go.
Mike and Kyle are waiting. After a moment, STEVE DELUCA, PRINCIPAL, emerges from his office and greets them. They walk into his office.
Mike is working at his desk. Shelly opens the door.
Hey Mike, we got a check from Leo Poplar's trust for $1,500 but it's made out to you and not the firm.
Right. I'll take that.
Mike gets up and takes the check.
Shouldn't I deposit it in the business account?
No. It's not a legal fee. It's a personal fee.
For what?
He puts on his coat.
Oh, I ended up taking on Leo's guardianship.
Really?
Yeah, I thought I mentioned that to you.
No, you definitely didn't mention that.
Yeah, well, it just played out that way. I have to get going.
He turns off his computer.
Well can we put some of that in the business account so they don't take our copier back?
Uh..not this time. Next month. Promise.
He grabs his briefcase and leaves.
We need our copier, Mike.
I know. Bye Shelly.
And that noise is getting louder. I'm not hung over today!
Mike walks out of the bank and dials his cell phone.
Hey honey. I'm good. Could you do me a favor and drop that health insurance check in the mail? I just forgot to mail it. Yeah, it's on my desk. Thanks. I'll call you later.
Terry is walking through the locker room. A few WRESTLERS BASKETBALL PLAYERS are getting dressed.
What's up Fella's? Hitting the showers, huh?
That sounded weird.
Mike and Vigman are in their office looking over a board.
Oh yeah!
Hey.
What's up? Hey Vig.
Hi Terry.
What are you doing here?
What do you think? I have to see this kid.
He's incredible. Just incredible. And he's good to wrestle.
Great. So what's next?
Terry pulls up a stool.
We're trying to figure out where he can wrestle?
Where ever the hell he wants, right?
No. Not right.
Kyle knocks at the door.
Hey Kyle. Come on in. How was school?
This is my friend Terry.
Terry, pops up, a bit too excitedly.
Hey man! Nice to meet you! Really nice to meet you. Welcome.
Thanks.
Mike tries to cover.
How the shoe's fit?
Good.
So let me ask you something, Kyle. You think you might want to wrestle in a match?
Great. We have a match on Saturday. What do you wrestle?
One-nineteen.
Excellent. Done.
Is anyone there now?
Yeah. Jimmy Reed. But I think he might be better off at 125.
Don't you think we should wrestle off?
Yeah.
KYLE's tying his NEW WRESTLING SHOES. The rest of the tea sitting around the mat.
Alright, let's go guys. Wrestle off.
Vig, you keep time?
Mike holds up a stop watch.
Yeah.
I'll do it.
Terry grabs the watch from Mike.
You don't mind, do you?
No. Go ahead.
Mike gives Terry a look. Vig minds. Kyle and JIMMY REED s hands. And set themselves on their marks.
Ready? And...wrestle.
Vigman blows his whistle and the room erupts in cheering. Most of it for Jimmy Reed except for Stemler who is rooti for Kyle.
Jimmy and Kyle lock arms but Kyle pushes him away. Jimmy locks again but Kyle pushes him away again. Jimmy comes i hard this time and Kyle uses his momentum to quickly thro him to the ground.
Jimmy tries to scramble to his knees but Kyle is all over him. He quickly locks Jimmy in a cradle and rocks him ont his back. It looks easy. Vigman calls the pin. The room i quiet...except for Terry.
Wow!
Mike shoots Terry a look. Kyle helps Jimmy off the mat.
Good match.
Didn't feel good.
Vigman turns to Mike and Terry.
I don't think we can teach him anything.
Mike, Terry, Kyle, Jackie and the kids are eating pizza.
I don't know why we didn't quit. Just the smell of that room brought back the memories. I hated it, it was like a form of self-abuse.
Were you guys that bad?
Mike was average. I sucked. Sorry Abby.
It's OK.
Mike checks his watch.
I gotta stop by the office and deal with the computer. Should I...?
No, I'll take him.
We both should have quit. Then we could have joined the ski club and gotten busy with Allison Shepard on the overnights.
Hey! Yo! Terry!
Who was busy?
Your Uncle Terry is just silly.
Sorry Abby. Getting busy is bad.
Kyle cracks up. Terry catches his eye.
Terry is sitting in Mike's office. A bottle of scotch and glasses on the desk.
Hey, how do you think we'd do against Kyle? Now?
He'd kill us. Both of us. Together.
Yeah, you're right. The kid has man strength, dude.
Mike emerges from under the desk.
Man strength?
Yeah. You know. Not kid strength. Man strength.
Yeah...I wouldn't say that around the locker room.
What the hell are you doing anyway?
Trying to figure out what's wrong with my fricking back-up system.
Just call your IT guy?
I don't have an IT guy. IT guys cost money.
OK. I'm just gonna say what's on my mind. I want to be an assistant coach too.
Seriously?
Yeah. Why not? I'm value added. Especially compared to Vig.
How are you value added?
Well first of all I'm fun. No denying that. And secondly, unlike Vig, I actually used to wrestle.
Yeah, but Ter, you sucked.
That doesn't matter, your team sucks. Plus I even look more like a coach then Vig.
Yeah, that's not really value added.

Look, Mike, I'm serious here. I need some distraction in my life right now. All I do is sit in my condo and think about Lori and that guy having sex in the jacuzzi I paid for. It's fucking unhealthy. I've been really kind of going crazy. Really.
Mike looks at his friend. He can tell he's serious.
We start at 3:30pm. Don't be late.
My brother! I will not let you down. To the team.
Terry raises his glass. Mike toasts.
Hey, what should I wear to practice?
Just a singlet.
Really?
Yeah, so we can see your man strength.
Good one, Coach! See, it's already fun.

Jackie is hanging laundry. She hears a phone ringing from laundry room. She peeks around the corner and sees that K is not there. She crosses to his phone and picks it up. I reads "Mom". She answers it.
Hello? Hello, this Jackie Flaherty. Kyle is staying with us. Hello? (She closes the phone) I'm gonna kill that lady.
She sets the phone down and turns. Kyle is standing on th stairs. His hair is wet and he's carrying his towel.
Oh. Hi. I heard your phone ringing and...
You answered it?
Yeah, well, I saw it was your Mom and we've been waiting to hear from her.
What'd she say?
She didn't say anything. She hung up. Have you talked to her?
No. Can you not answer my phone anymore?
Yeah. OK. I can do that. I'm sorry.
Jackie heads back to laundry room. She stops at the stair
Oh. Here's a bucket. You shouldn't be smoking but if you do could you put the cigarettes in here.
I quit now that I'm wrestling
Oh. Good. OK.
She leaves. Kyle walks over the couch and picks up his ph
Mike and Jackie are sleeping. A sound from downstairs. Th door opens and shut. Mike sits up and listens.
Is that Abby?
If it is, she just ran away.
Mike walks into the kitchen. Kyle is drinking water.
Were you outside?
Yeah. I went for a run.
It's pretty early. You do this every morning?
In season, yeah. I like to get my run in early and then drill some moves for an hour before school.
Oh. Wow.
Yeah...so I'm gonna do it. See you.
Kyle walks downstairs.
Mike climbs back into bed. Jackie barely moves.
It was Kyle.
What's he doing?
Working out.
Is he gonna do it every morning?
In season. Yeah.
Beat.
I hate you.
I know.
Kyle takes off his shirt and stands on the scale wearing his underwear. He's lean and muscular. He has a TATOO on right arm and PAIR OF WINGS TATOO on his shoulder blades.
Jesus! Look at those tats.
This kid is just fricking cool.
Timmons. One nineteen. Good.
The New Providence team jogs out to the mat. There are ma twenty people there. A PUNK ROCK SONG is playing.
This song sucks.
Rew picked it. He's an odd one.
Hey Vig, which kid is yours anyway?
None of them. He quit.
Really? You're son quit?
My step son and yes. Don't get me started, I thought becoming a coach might be a nice way for us to bond. He said it wasn't fierce and he quit.
Harsh. So why you still doing it?
Vig is leading by example. Winners never quit.
That's right, even if it sucks. This team is just depressing sometimes.
Terry sits next to Mike.
That's where I sit, Ter.
Sorry buddy. I got to be near, Mike. It's good luck.
Say's who?
Guys. I don't think we should fight about our seats in front of the kids.

The Pioneers are getting beat. Carlos is wrestling and putting up a good fight but time is running out and he's by three points. He tries a desperate takedown but it backfires and the other wrestler picks up another two poi The buzzer sounds. Match over.
The team gets up to greet Carlos. Kyle strips off his swe and buckles up his head gear. He walks up to Mike for a p talk.
OK. You ready?
Yeah.
This kid is good. So just...you know...be ready out there.
Terry gives Vigman a look. "Be ready?"
Can you give me a slap?
What?
Give me a slap. Across the face. Like your waking me up.
Uh, OK.
Mike cuffs Kyle on the side of the head gear.
Can you do it harder?
Mike slaps him hard. And Kyle sprints to the mat and take his stance.
The Ref blows the whistle and the wrestlers circle each other. The OTHER WRESTLER is clearly on the offensive.
Come on, Kyle. Take this punk out.
(Under his breath) Ter! Cut the shit! You're a coach. You're not sitting in the stands.
Sorry. I'm just excited. You know me.
The Other Wrestler shoots a single and takes Kyle down. T points.
What's he doing?
Losing.
It's his first match. Give him a break.
The Other Wrestler is relentless. Kyle keeps trying to ge and the kid keeps breaking him down. Kyle stands up and O Wrestler slams him to the mat. Kyle is getting beat up.
The two Wrestlers go out of bounds and the Ref stops the action. Kyle gets up and Mike checks in with him.
Hey! You OK?
Yeah.
Kyle gets into the bottom position.
Did he smile?
Yeah. I think he did.
Good. That's good, right?
The Ref blows the whistle and Kyle explodes to his feet, kicking a leg back between the Other Wrestler's legs. He lower's his body, reaches behind him and whips the Other Wrestler to the mat.
He drops down and puts him a double arm bar and runs the Other Wrestler right up over his own shoulders. The Ref d to the mat and calls the pin. Match over. The Team jumps and cheers.
See. I'm good luck.
That's got nothing to do with luck.

Kyle shakes the other wrestler's hands and the Ref raises hand in victory. Kyle crosses to the opposing coaches and shakes their hands. Then he runs to back to his bench. Mi greets him with a handshake.
How'd that feel? Pretty good?
Yeah, pretty good.
Mike smiles and Kyle sits down. The next wrestler, Jimmy steps up to Mike.
You ready?
Yeah. Can you slap me too, Coach?
Mike laughs. And then he slaps him.
Mike, Kyle and Abby are watching TV. Jackie walks in putt on her coat.
I'm going to the market. I'll be back in a bit.
Can I go with you?
Uh...yeah OK.
Kyle gets up to get his coat. Jackie looks at Mike who ju shrugs.
I want to go with Kyle.
No, honey. It's almost bed time.
Jackie is shopping. Kyle catches up to her. He is carryin two BOXES OF CEREAL. He doesn't put them in the basket.
Coco Puffs. Is that your brand?
It's for Leo.
Nice. Drop it in, it's on me. Go ahead.
How's he doing?
He's doing OK. He can say some pretty funny things. Yesterday he told me I was fired.
Fired? For what?
I don't know. He just fired me.
I think I have to meet this Leo.
Yeah. He's a pretty funny dude.
You have any home work?
A little but I already did it.
Impressive. You ever think about going to college?
Yeah but just to wrestle. My old coach thought I could get a scholarship.
Yeah, I hear you're pretty good. So why'd you quit?
Kyle just shrugs.
You don't have to tell me. It's alright.
They keep walking. Jackie grabs a box of tacos from the shelf.
Do you like tacos?
Yeah.
Me, too. I make a mean taco.

location: NEW PROVIDENCE HIGH SCHOOL, THE PIT

text: The team is jogging in circles around the mat. Mike, Vigm and Terry, stand in the middle of the circle talking.
Let's go! Circle up!
Alright. I want to spend this week working on bottom position. Did you all see Kyle the other day? He exploded up. Kyle, show the guys what you did.
Kyle is caught off guard. He hesitates
It's kind of my own thing.
So can you share it with us?

Well, it's not a move or anything, I just tell myself that the guy on top is going to take my head and shove it under water and kill me. And if I don't want to die on the bottom, I just gotta do what ever the fuck it takes to get out.
This kid is intense. His words really land with Mike.
OK. So the move is called "whatever the fuck it takes." Let's go. Let's work on it. Come on. "Whatever the fuck it takes."
Vigman claps and the wrestlers start to move.

location: OAK KNOLL SENIOR LIVING, COMMUNAL ROOM

text: Kyle sitting in the communal room at a table with Leo. Ky is doing homework. Leo is staring out the window. Court T playing in the background.
You're mother didn't want to come?
No.
She's a tough kid that one. She tell you bad things about me?
Yeah. But I never believe her anyway.
You should, she's your mother. Respect that. (Pointng to the TV) Can you turn that down? I hate that judge. I wouldn't be in this place if it wasn't for her.
But this place is pretty nice.
It's not my damn house! I paid for that house. Damn Judge. Turn it off!
You want to take a walk outside, Leo?
Yeah. Let's go to my park.
Your park, huh?
Yeah. My park.
Mike and Kyle get out of the car and unload a couple of s mats from the backseat.
You bring the tape?
Yeah. It's in my bag.
Mike grabs his briefcase from the trunk.
Hey, Mike, can I ask you something?
Yeah. Of course. What?
Leo told me that some Judge made him move into that place. Is that true or is he just making that up?
Mike wasn't expecting this.
No. That's true, pal.
Why?
Well because they can take good care of him there, Kyle.
Mike's phone rings.
But he wants to live at home.
I know, pal. Hang on a minute. (Into cell phone) Hello? Yes. This is him.
Oh. Can you hang for a moment?
Hey, I have to take this. I'll be right in, OK? We can talk in a minute.
Kyle walks inside. Mike watches him go, already regrettin the lie. He exhales...
Hi. Sorry to keep you waiting. Yeah. How are you doing?
Jackie it the sink. Stella is eating. Mike is sitting at the table with a beer.
What? She doesn't even know us!
Yeah, well I think she heard that I'm a lawyer and I have a family and that was good enough.
For how long?
Another month, I guess, until she gets out of rehab. She said that Craig guy took off. She sounded pretty shaky.
I can't believe this lady.
Jackie joins Mike at the table.
Yeah. I know. Where is he anyway?
In the basement with Abby.
This is crazy.
Yes, it is. So what do we do?
We let him stay. I don't know, do we even have a choice?
I guess we don't.
A school bus drives through the New Jersey Farm country.
Kyle is siting on the bus listening to his Ipod. Stemler sitting next to him.
You nervous?
No.
I am.
You're not wrestling.
I know. I'm just nervous a lot.
You ever think about wrestling in a match?

Yeah. I'm just waiting for the green light from Coach. But I'm glad I'm not wrestling today. These guys are ranked fourth in the state. And you're wrestling Kenny Randall. He's undefeated. He is tough! Really tough.
Thanks for letting me know.
Vigman stands up at the front of the bus.
Hey! Cut the chatter! You should all be playing the "what if" game. What if he shoots a single leg? What if he controls my wrists?
What if we all get pinned like last year?
Shut up, Stemler! Or I'll throw you off the bus myself!
Vigman sits back down next to Terry.
Did they really pin all of you?
Just about. It's gonna be a fucking bloodbath.
Multiple Pins. It's a bloodbath. Jackie, Abby and Stella in the stands and they look depressed. Kyle's next up.
OK. This is Kenny Randall. He's very good.
Yeah, I heard.
But you have an advantage here, he has no idea who you are, right?
So he's gonna be overconfident. You take advantage of that and when you get your shot, put him away.
Kyle nods and Mike slaps him across the face and Kyle spr to his place on the mat and gets ready. Mike turns to the team.
See how he runs out there? I want that kind of intensity from all of you.
Why did Daddy hit Kyle?
I don't know, honey.

The Ref blows the whistle and the match starts. As Mike predicted KENNY RANDALL tries to end the match quickly wi throw but Kyle is too strong and too good. Kyle counters throws Kenny to his back. Before anyone can blink, Kyle p him. Mike, Terry, and Vigman explode off their chairs.
Yeah! Holy shit!
He just pinned Kenny Randall. Are you kidding me?!

Kenny Randall looks shocked. He throws off his head gear gets up. The MILBURN COACHES look equally shocked. The Re raises Kyle's hands. Kyle runs over to shake the Milburn Coaches hand and then he runs back to his bench and is greeted by Mike.
He know's who I am now.
Mike smiles as the team greets him.
Jackie and Stella are sitting on the ground. Kyle walks i
Hi, can I watch TV in here?
Yeah but I want to show you something. Stella, who's that?
Ky.
Kyle laughs.
She started saying it at the match today.
That's cool.
OK. So I have to ask, those tatoo's must have hurt, right?
Not really.
Don't lie to me. Look.
Jackie lifts her pant leg. She has a small tatoo on her ankle.
I got it on Spring Break. Hurt like hell.
What's it say?
JBJ. Jon Bon Jovi. I'm a fan. You got a problem with that?
No I do not.
That was fun today. You're good. I'm glad you started wrestling again.
Yeah. Me too.
No quitting this time, you got that?
Can I tell you something?
Of course.
I didn't quit my old team. I got thrown off.
Why?
I stole a car.
What? You're don't even drive.
Yeah. That was part of the problem.
Who's car did you steal?
A teacher's.
Oh my God.
It was really stupid.
Yeah. It was stupid. You could have killed yourself.
Yeah. Everything just got messed up after that.
Yeah, well we all do stupid things. But the best part is that you got a another chance and now you're kicking butt.
I guess.
It's true. And you know who would agree with me?
Mike?
Jackie lifts her leg.
Nope. JBJ.
Jackie lifts her leg exposing her tatoo. Kyle smiles.
The Pioneers race out onto the mat to do warm-ups before home match. They are fired up. There are more fans in the stands. Terry and Vig bob their head to the music.
Kyle looks up at Jackie, Shelly and kids who are also roc out in the stands.
Kyle and Jackie walk through a park with Leo.
The wrestling team sprints through the empty hallways.
Kyle and Stemler are battling it out on the Wii. Stemler wearing a helmet.
Mike pours himself some coffee. Jackie is feeding the kid

The basement door opens and Kyle walks out followed by Feeney, Jimmy, Carlos, and Stemler. They are all sweating profusely. Mike is about to sip his coffee when Terry wal out. He nods and follows the gang.

Terry and Kyle stand side by side holding onto two ropes. Mike is cutting down the dead tree with a chain saw. Jack Abby watch from the front porch. Mike finishes cutting an Terry and Kyle pull the tree over. Success. Mike lifts hi arms in triumph.
Mike, Vigman and Terry are preparing for the match.
They don't have anyone at heavyweight.
Really? Korsic will be happy. Tell him now so he doesn't puke.
Why does he puke? He's a heavyweight. He doesn't have to lose weight.
Nerves.
Sweet Lord. This is a team for the ages.
Kyle knocks on the door. Stemler is with him.
What's up, guys?
Stemler wants to wrestle today.
You do?
Yeah, Coach. I'm pretty sure I'm ready. Right?
Right.
Where you gonna wrestle?
He could wrestle 119. I could bump up and get a pin at 125 and Jimmy goes 130. Then we're only giving up one weight class and we got a shot.
Vig and Terry look at Mike.
Huh. Vig?
Yeah. He's right. It's possible.
Have you ever wrestled in a match before Stemler?
No, I have not.
You're just waiting for the green light, right?
Right. I think now is my time. I can feel the force.
The three coaches all look at each other.
Terry holds up a CUP OF STICKS with weight classes writte them. The BERKLEY HEIGHTS COACH selects a stick and reads weight.
One twenty-five.

We start at 125 pounds. Depasquale and Timmons. We'll finish at 119 pounds. Tomlinson and Stemler.

Carlos does and holds on for the win. The team cheers. Mi turns to Vigman and Terry.

Stemler nods.
If you get in trouble out there, you just listen to me. I'm right here, OK?
Stemler nods again. Too scared to respond.
OK. You are not going to get pinned! You hear me! No way!
No way. No way.
Good. Now I'm going to slap you. Ready?
Yeah but not so hard.
Mike gives him an odd half-slap and Stemler runs out to t mat and takes his place at the line. The team cheers.
But then the other WRESTLER runs out. He is wearing a BLA PROTECTIVE FACE MASK. Stemler spins away from the line an looks pleading at Mike.
Holy shit! It's Darth Vader! Are you kidding me? No way!
He does look like Darth Vader. But in a singlet.
Don't worry. It's just a mask. You are ready! Get on that line. Now!
Hey, Stemler. Come here.
Stemler walks over.
If he's Darth Vader then you're the Secret Apprentice. You got this.
Stemler buys it.
Yeah. You're right.
Stemler returns to the line slightly more confident. The blows the whistle and the match starts. Stemler is immediately taken down. Terry looks at his feet.
I can't watch.
It's late in third period. Stemler is losing 13-0. Stemle is flat on his belly and he's getting mauled. The Ref cal him for stalling. One point. 14-0. Thirty seconds to go.
Keep moving, Stemler. Keep working!
(Reading score card) Oh shit. Oh shit!
What?
He's one point away from a tech fall and we'd lose on criteria.
Shit. Really?
What the hell does that mean?
If he falls behind by fifteen points it's a technical fall. They get five team points. If that happens the score would be tied but we'd lose the match on criteria.
Seriously?
Fuck this!
Mike drops to the mat.
Stemler! Stemler!!
Stemler looks over. His eyes are wild.
You need to get up! He's trying to drown you! He wants you dead. But you are not going to die on the bottom! Do you hear me? Do you?!
Stemler manages a nod, albeit a terrified one.
Good! Now just do the move we worked on in practice.
Off Stemler's confused look.
"Whatever the fuck it takes!"
Stemler almost manages a smile and then he hits "the move It's not pretty but somehow he manages to get up and out. team goes nuts. One point for Stemler. 15-1.
The Other kid frantically tries to take him down but Stem holds him off dancing wildly around the mat. The buzzer sounds. The team goes nuts.
The Ref raises the other wrestler's hand in victory but i Stemler who celebrates as if he just won the states. He r off the mat and into the arms of his teammates.
Mike and Kyle walk through the empty hallway.
Hey, I'm proud of what you did today. That win meant a lot to the guys.
Cool. It was good coaching with Stemler.
Mike laughs. Then he just looks at Kyle.
Let me ask you something. What's it like? Being as good as you are? What's it feel like?
I don't know. I guess it just feels like I'm in control. Of everything. You know what I mean?
Yeah, I do. Must be nice.
It is.

The DISTRICT TOURNAMENT. Kyle is ahead in points going in the second period. He chooses the top position. The Ref b the whistle and the OTHER WRESTLER sits out and Kyle simp sucks him onto his back. It almost looks too easy.
That's it.
Yeah.
District champ, baby.
Pure fucking poetry.
The Ref slaps the mat and it's over.
Kyle walks into Leo's room.
Hey, Leo. Guess who won the Districts?
Who?
Me. And Mike said he got a call from a college scout about me.
Oh.
Hi baby.
A THIRTY-EIGHT YEAR OLD WOMAN standing in the door way. T is CINDY TIMMONS. Kyle's mother.
What are you doing here?
I came to get you, honey. And to see Grandpa. I missed you so much. Can I have a hug, baby?
Kyle looks at Leo who just shrugs. Finally, he walks towa her but then veers away and runs from the room.
Where's he going?
Oh, he's just had to go somewhere, Dad. Do you want some juice?

location: MIKE AND JACKIE'S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM

text: Mike is watching Stella who is playing on the ground. Jac comes up from the basement.
How is he?
He's upset. I don't blame him. It's weird that she just shows up like that. (Checking her watch) And of course she's late, the druggie.
Honey. Can you stop, please?
You're gonna talk to her, right?
Yeah. I am. If you don't punch her first.
Car lights in the window. Mike looks out the window.
It's a cab. It's her.
It's not my fault if I punch her.
Yeah, it is. That will be your fault.
Jackie picks up Stella. The door bell rings. Mike answers Cindy is standing there. She looks nervous.
Hi. I'm Mike Flaherty. Come in, please.
Hi.
And this is my wife, Jackie and my daughter, Stella.
Hi.
Hi, Cindy. Nice to meet you.
She's very cute.
Thanks. Abby, our six year old, is downstairs with Kyle.
Oh. OK.
Awkward pause.
Do you want to sit down?
Thanks. This is a very nice house.
Thank you very much.
Can I get you a drink or something?
Jackie shoots Mike a look. A drink?
Water or soda or anything?
No. No thanks. I'm fine.
Right. OK. So I'll go get Kyle.
Mike starts to go but Cindy doesn't quite seem ready.
How's he doing?
Oh, he's doing really well. He's going to the high school here and he's wrestling on the team actually.
Really? That's good. He loves wrestling so much.
He's a really sweet kid. Our girls love him.
That's nice.
Cindy starts to tremble.
I am so sorry about this...it's just been such a difficult time...
Jackie and Mike share a look. Then Jackie caves and slide over next to her.
Oh hey...these things happen, Cindy. And we've loved having him.
Mike rolls his eyes. So much for beating the crap out of Abby walks upstairs.
Hi, honey. This is Abby.
Hi Abby.
Hi.
Abby, can you go get Kyle for us?
He left.
He left? What do you mean?
He left out the window.
Mike and Cindy are driving.
I'm really sorry about this.
That's okay. Thanks.
You know Kyle's doing really well with wrestling here, Cindy. The regions are this weekend and if he wins there then he goes to the states.
That's great.
Yeah. It is and it could be really good for him. It might even mean a scholarship. Anyway, I was wondering if you could stay here for another three weeks until that's all over.
Cindy thinks about it.
I'd like to but don't think I can afford to stay in the hotel for that long. Do you think we could stay in my dad's house?
This is not what Mike wanted but he's stuck.
Uhh...yeah. We could probably make that work.
Then, yeah, I could stay.
OK. Good. That's great.
Mike's phone rings.
Hey.
Hey. Kyle's here.
Really?
We found him.
Terry looks into the other room. Kyle is playing on the W
Yeah. We're playing Wii Golf. I'm destroying him. Dude, this kid really hates his mother.
Mike is driving.
Yeah, OK.
I mean like more then I hate my ex wife.
Great, Ter. Thanks. Bye. (Mike hangs up) He went to my friend's house. We can go get him.
Maybe I'll just go back to the hotel. It might just be too much for him tonight. I can see him tomorrow.
You sure?
Yeah. I think maybe that's better. I know how Kyle can be.
OK. I'll drop you off.
Mike keeps driving.
Mike and Kyle are jogging. Kyle's mood is dark.
So when wrestling's over I have to go?
I'm afraid so, pal. She's staying so you can finish the season. That's pretty nice of her.
They arrive back at Mike's house. Mike is really winded.
I told her you'd go see her today, Kyle.
Where?
Where ever you want. She could come here or we could go see her at Leo's house. She moving in this morning.
Kyle thinks.
I'll go see her at Leo's before practice. But I want to go alone.
Yeah, that's OK but Kyle but you have to promise me...
Don't worry, Mike. I'll go.
Mike turns and spots his OLD NEIGHBOR watching him.
Hi Mike.
Hi Betty. How's the foot?
Better.
Mike is attempting to plunge the toilet. Shelly approache him.
Mike? Cindy's here.
Really? Did she say why?
No. But she's here with an attorney.
Mike gets up and opens the door to his office. Eleanor an Cindy stand to greet him.
Hi Cindy. Hi, I'm Mike Flaherty.
Cindy nods.
Hi, I'm Eleanor Cohen.
Please come in.
He leads them into his office.
I wasn't aware that Cindy was represented by council.
She retained me last week to help sort out her father's situation.
Last week? I thought she just arrived two days ago.
How long have you been here?
She wanted a little time to settle in and spend some time with her father.
So how can I help?
Cindy has decided that she wants a more active role in her father's care.
What kind of a role is that?
I want to take care of him.
Really? So you want to move here?
No. Cindy would like to bring her father back to Columbus.
That's where my support network is now. It's home.
Well I'm not sure that's what Leo wants.
I already talked to him about it. He seem to like the idea.
I understand that, Cindy. But you haven't seen Leo in a long time and he's battling dementia now so it puts me in a tough position here.
She is the presumed Guardian, Mr Flaherty.
I understand that.
And we do hope to avoid litigation.
So do I and I'm sure we can. Now, I'm sorry, but I actually have to go see a client so we'll have to set up another time to discuss this.
Kyle's still coming to see me today, right?
Yeah. Of course. After school.
I'll have my office call. Come on Cindy.
Thanks Mike.
Mike nods and Eleanor and Cindy leave. Mike watches them CLANK. CLANK. CLANK.
Mike walks out of the Convenience Store, around the corne and behind the store. He lights a cigarette.
I don't get it. Is it that bad?
Mike and Terry are standing outside talking.
Yeah, it's that bad.
Just take her to court, you'll kill her.
I can't.
Why not? She's a freaking mess. You're a pillar of the community, Mike.
I just can't go back in front of Judge Lee, it won't look good, trust me.
So maybe you'll get a different judge.
She's the only Judge who handles these cases and if I look bad in front of her right now, I'm screwed. I'll have to close my fricking doors.
Then dump it. Give her Poplar. It sucks but you've got your practice to worry about, right?

Incoming, dude.
Mike turns. Kyle approaches.
Hey, pal.
Do you know she wants to take Leo back to Ohio?
Yeah. She just told me today.
You're not gonna let her do that are you?

What's complicated about it? She doesn't give a shit about Leo. They hate each other. You can't let her take him.
OK. OK. Look, just go get ready for practice and I'll deal with it.
Fine but I told her I'm staying with you guys until we leave.
Kyle leaves. Terry just looks at Mike.
Wow. What's your play?
I have no idea. I have no freaking idea!
She's looking for a payout, dude. Just buy her stake and give her an exit.
What the hell does that mean?
Just give her some of Leo's money and send her home. He's not gonna miss it. He's in happy land.
No, I can't do that. She's not even in his...

Mike takes out his phone and dials.

Really? You want me to slap your face? Get you psyched up for the call?
No. I really don't.
Mike walks into the brick and glass tower.

Mike is siting down with Eleanor and Cindy.

Is that true?

Yeah. I actually brought you a copy.
Mike reaches into his briefcase and puts the A COPY OF TH WILL on Eleanor's desk.
Who did he leave it too? Did he leave it to Kyle?!
No.
Then who? You?
No. He left everything to the municipal parks system. He wanted the town park dedicated in his name.
That scumbag! He never cared about anyone but himself and his fucking money. Did you know about this?
Cindy please!
Please what?
(Annoyed to Mike) I'd like to discuss this with my client, Mr. Flaherty.
What's to discuss? I'm not taking care of him if I'm not getting anything for it.
Cindy, please.
We're finished here.
Mike gets up and walks out. A smile creeps across his fac
Jackie, Gina and the kids settle into the bleachers. A LA BANNER reads NORTHEAST REGIONAL TOURNAMENT.
Mike and Terry walking down the hallway eating SNICKER BA
Brass balls, buddy. Brass balls.
Yeah. And she's gone back to the motel.
That's good.
Yes, it is. Yeah, I think it worked.
It totally worked. They opened their kimono and you made them eat the trade.
I don't what know what your talking about half the time.
Really?
Yeah. Really.
Kyle is warming up. Vigman is watching. Mike and Terry en

You ready?
Kyle just walks out of the warm-up room.
He's ready.
Yeah, he is.
The four men walk into the huge gym. It's packed. Kyle is completely focused.
Wow. This is big time. I bet there are scouts here.
Definitely. And wait till we get to the states! Atlantic City here we come, baby.
Atlantic City. Fierce.
Mike smiles but then his smile fades. Cindy Timmons is standing against the wall. She steps forward and Kyle see

Kyle keeps his head down and keeps walking. Mike looks shocked but also keeps walking.
Mike and Kyle are face to face.
Listen to me. One more win and we are going to the states. That's what counts. That's all that matters. You hear me?
Kyle nods. Mike can tell that he's half listening.
Hey! Kyle. Stay in this, OK. This is your place. You are in control, remember! You control it. Now go get him. Finish this!

The wrestlers slap hands and THE REF blows the whistle. K immediately shoots in for a double leg. The Other Wrestle tries to sprawl but Kyle is in too deep. Kyle lifts him h and dumps him hard to the mat. The audience reacts and th Ref stops the action. The other wrestler bravely pops up he is obviously stung.

Kyle looks at Mike and nods but his eyes are wild. The Re blows the whistle and Kyle and the Other Wrestler lock up They dance a bit and finally the Other Wrestler tries to Kyle up. Kyle back pedals and then literally throws the O Wrestler off the mat. The Ref has seen enough. He quickly issues Kyle his second warning and disqualifies him from match. It's over.
The Other Wrestler pops up and runs at Kyle. Kyle respond The Coaches all intervene. It's a melee.

How you doing?
Kyle stares at the floor.
I'm sorry.
Hey, it's alright.
Mike puts his arm on his shoulder and Kyle starts to cry. Mike squeezes him.
I don't want to go with her. I don't.
OK, pal. OK.

Mike, Terry and Kyle walk out of the school. The entire family is waiting for them. Jackie gives Kyle a big hug. takes his hand. They all get into their car. Mike is just about to get in but then he sees Cindy standing by her ca watching. He shuts his door and crosses to her.
Why are you here?
I wanted to see my son wrestle.
Yeah, well your son had a pretty good chance to do something special in there. Maybe even change his life and that's gone now. I hope you're happy.
That's not my fault.
It isn't? Why do you think he lost his shit in there, huh?! What do you want, lady?
I want my father.
It didn't sound like that the other day. It sounded like you hated the guy.
You have no idea what my father used to be like. No idea! He wasn't like he is now! He treated me like shit and he was all I had!
So now you want to return the favor? Is that it?!
I want that commission! That should be mine!
And that's why you're doing all this? For fifteen hundred dollars a month?
Isn't that why you did it?
This stops Mike in his tracks.
Alright, I'll tell you what. You want the commission? You can have it. And you don't even have to take Leo. I'll take care of him for free and I'll send you the check every month. On one condition.
What's that?
You leave Kyle here. With us. Until he finishes high school.
I'm his mother. He belongs with me.
Are you sure he feels that way?
Don't tell me what my son feels! He's coming with me and there isn't anything you can do about that.
Then you can't have that commission.
We'll see about that.
Yeah, we will.
Mike turns and walks away.
I want to see my son!
Then call him! You have his number!

location: MIKE AND JACKIE'S HOUSE, BACK PORCH

text: Mike sits on the back porch nursing a beer. Terry stands the yard facing away from him.
We were right there, Mike. Right fucking there. And now we have nothing. Nothing!
Terry screams. It's a primal scream. Mike just looks at h

He's not in the basement?
No.
I'll track him down.

You OK?

And you don't think you'd beat her in court?

Mike turns to Jackie. He wants to tell her but just can't
I just can't win this one, Jackie. Trust me.
Jackie misinterprets Mike's guilt for pain. She backs off
I do.

Cindy is smoking next to the open window. She is nervous. knock on the door. She throws the cigarette out the windo and closes it. She checks herself in the mirror and opens door. Kyle is standing there.
Kyle, honey, come in. I'm so glad you came.
She steps back and he enters.
Have a seat, honey. Do you want a soda or something?
He sits on one bed.
No. What do you want?
She sits on the other facing him.
I just wanted to say how sorry I was about the match and if I did anything to cause it then I will never forgive myself. I know how much wrestling means to you, baby.
Is that why you called me. Just to tell me that?
No. I also wanted to say that I'll do whatever you think is best for Leo. I promise.
Then leave him here. Where he is.

Kyle stares at the page.
Leo belongs with us, Kyle.
Why?
Cindy is caught of guard by the question.
Why what?
Why does he belong with us?
Cindy judges her son's look and speaks from the heart.
Because we deserve that money, Kyle. Not some lawyer. You're a big boy. You can understand that.

She finally quiets. Terrified.
Listen to me! I don't care about this. It's all bullshit. Leave Leo alone. He belongs here. Do you hear me? Do you?
Cindy can only cry and nod. Kyle grabs the paper and runs the door.
Mike paces around talking on the phone.
OK. Thanks, Karen. I appreciate it. Bye.
Jackie walks into the room.
Anything?
He's not at Stemler's.
This is crazy, where could he be?
I don't know, he's upset, maybe he went for a walk.
Well we should take a drive, your mom can stay with the kids.
His phone rings. Jackie stops.
Hello. Yes, this is him. What?
A STAFF MEMBER is at the desk.
Sir, stay calm, we'll find him.
Stay calm? You've lost my ward!
Mike! Calm down.
Calm down?! We are gonna sue you guys, silly. He's a laywer!

Mike and Jackie share a look and leave. Terry turns to so residents who are looking on.
Hey folks, listen up! Watch out for each other.

There's a light on.
It's got to be him. Do have the key?
No. I didn't bring it with me.
They arrive at the front door. Mike tries the knob. It's locked.
Shit.
Mike goes to edge of the porch, climbs up onto the railin and looks into the side window. Leo is sitting in a chair watching TV.
There he is!
What's he doing?
Watching TV.
What's he watching?
Who cares?
Leo? Hey Leo?
Mike knocks on the window. Leo doesn't register it.
He's not responding. Ring the bell.
Jackie does. Leo still doesn't respond.
Nothing. Fuck.
This is freaking spooky.
Mike climbs down back onto the porch.
Should we break in?
I have a key back at the office. I could go get it.
Is he OK?
He seems it. He's just sitting there.
Suddenly the door opens. Leo is standing there.
Hi.
Hi./Hey.
Come on in.
Leo walks away. They all follow him.
OK. That is very creepy.
They walk into the house following Leo into the living ro He sits back in his chair and start watching TV again.
You OK, Leo?
Leo just watches TV.
How did you get here, pal?
Mike stoops over and tries to connect with Leo.
Did you walk here, Leo?
Leo turns and looks at them as if he is about to speak. T all wait for his reply and then...
I brought him here.
They all jump.
Kyle? You took Leo?
Yeah.
Have you lost your mind?! We've been worried sick about him!
About both of you!
You don't have to worry about us.
Kyle walks out of the room.
OK. That's super spooky. Just saying.
Kyle walks into the kitchen, he turns off a pot of boilin water and strains some pasta.
Kyle, What the hell are you doing?
Making spaghetti.
Have you lost your mind?
No.
Kyle, why did you do this? Please just tell us. Leo needs to be in a home.
This is where he belongs.
Kyle he needs to be at Oak Knoll.
Kyle, we talked about this.
Yeah. We did! Listen to this.
Kyle takes a piece of paper out of his pocket.
Mike Flaherty: Mr. Poplar wants to live at home. Judge Lee: You can do that Mike? Mike Flaherty: Yes, I can. Really.
What is that?
Jackie takes it and looks at it.
It's from the court.
Where did you get this?
From my mother.
It's true isn't, Mike?
Mike?
Mike can't answer. Kyle's seen enough.
You're just like her.
He runs out. They all give chase.
Mike runs outside and see's Kyle crossing the lawn. He quickly catches up to him. Terry and Jackie follow close behind.
Hey. Hey, Kyle.
Kyle keeps walking.
Hey can you hold on a second?
Leave me alone!
Kyle please.
Mike grabs Kyle one more time. Kyle rips his arm away and tries to push Mike back.
Don't touch me!
Mike deflects Kyle and Kyle spills to the ground.
Oh shit.
Kyle gets up and starts to circle Mike. Mike has no choic but reciprocate.
Would you let me explain?!
