Kyle head pumps. Mike takes the bait and jumps back.
Kyle wait... Watch the head fake!
Kyle I don't want to wrestle you.
Kyle, stop for a minute. Keep your hands out, Mike. Hands out.
Terry, stop it!
I'm just trying to help.
You're not helping.
Kyle head fakes again but this time he's in. Before Mike knows what hits him, he's on his back.
Ow! Oh shit.
Mike, stop it!
Kyle is all over Mike. Mike's trying to fight back but it useless and even kind of pathetic.
I'm trying to stop it!
Sit out Mike! Sit out!
Shut up, Terry! Kyle, stop it!
Mike gets up to hands and knees but Kyle drives him hard the ground.
Ow! Shit! Ouch! He's getting killed.
Would you stop coaching and break that up!
Terry rushes in and tries to pull Kyle off but he's lost Finally, he wraps his arms around Kyle and pulls him off. Kyle spins free and fronts Terry. Terry immediately puts his hands.
I'm the ref. I'm just the ref!
Kyle turns and runs off.
Kyle! Stop! Please!
He doesn't stop. Jackie turns to Mike.
Is that true, Mike?
Yeah, it is.
Mike gets up.
So why'd you move him if he wanted to stay here.
Because it would have been too much work to leave him here. I couldn't have done it.
Then you shouldn't have taken him.
I had to, alright?
Why?!
Because I needed the money! We needed the money.
You moved an old man out of his house to make money? Have you lost your freaking mind?
No! I just didn't think it would get this complicated.
Really? Or you just didn't think you'd get caught?
This stops Mike in his tracks. He can't answer. Jackie tu and walks away.
Jack! Jack, where are you going?
Home!
She walks away.
Stemler is sleeping on one couch. Kyle on the other. Kyle cell phone rings. He wakes up and checks it. He answers i
Hello. Hello. Mom?
She's not there. He hangs up. Kyle starts to put on his shoes.
Did your mom just crank call you?
No.
So you and Coach Mike get in a fight because you lost?
No. We got in a fight because he's an asshole.
Really?
Yeah, really, Stem.
Well I'm sure he'll make it up to you, bro. You're the best wrestler he's ever had. I mean he's always been cool to me and I suck.
This comment lands with Kyle.
Mike is sleeping on a love seat. He wakes up. Leo is sitt there watching him.
Hey Leo.
Hi.
I fell asleep. I'm sorry.
Sorry for what?
That's a big question. Mike cuts to the chase.
You want to go home?
Yeah.
Jackie is sitting with Stella and a cup of coffee. The fr door opens and closes. Mike walks into the kitchen.
Hi.
Hi. Is he here?
No. He slept at Stemler's. How about you?
Oak Knoll.
You're right, that's not who I am.
So what are you going to do?
I have to go court.
You can't. You told the Judge you were keeping Leo at home.
I know.
So then tell her you changed your mind. No one can question that.
I can't, Jack.
Why not?
Because it's not true.
Well I'm glad your done lying now, just in time to lose your practice. That's how we survive, Mike. Your family. You ever think of that?
Yeah. All the time.
Jackie quickly crosses to the sink. She starts to clean. breaks something.
Shit.
She braces herself against the sink and exhales. Mike jus watches her.
I'm sorry, Jack. I really am.
I know.
A noise from the basement. Mike heads down the stairs.
Jackie and Mike walk downstairs. Kyle is angrily gatherin his stuff and putting it in his back pack.
Hey Kyle. How'd you get down here?
The window.
Are you hungry? I was gonna make some pancakes.
No. I'm leaving. I just came to get my shit.
They share a look and walk over to Kyle.
Kyle, listen, I just wanted to say I'm sorry...
I know, Mike, you're sorry. Everyone's always sorry.
I moved Leo back home, Kyle. And I'm gonna fight to keep him there.
It's too late. You'll lose. My mother's gonna take him.
Maybe but I'm still gonna try.
So what?! You want me to forgive you now? Is that it, Mike?!
No. I just want you to give me another chance. That's all I'm asking.
Mike's sincerity is undeniable. Kyle looks to Jackie. The connect. Kyle shakes his head, turns around, and then thr his bag.
This is bullshit!
Mike looks at Jackie.
Hey, Kyle, listen -
I want to be alone.
What?
(Without looking at them)

head_text.subj: I JUST WANT TO BE DOWN HERE ALONE

text: OK. All right. Yeah.
Jackie and Mike turn and start to walk upstairs but Jacki stops.
Kyle, I just wanna say - we love you.
Kyle keeps his back turned to them as they continue up th stairs.
Tight on the Baby Monitor. We hear Stella crying and Jack talking to Abby.
Abby, just pick a shirt and put it on. Please.
Mike is sitting alone at the kitchen table drinking a cup coffee. The remnants of a pancake breakfast are on the ta There is one clean plate where Kyle usually sits.
After a moment, Kyle comes up from the basement and sits at the table without saying anything.
He just looks at Mike. Then he serves himself a few panca Mike passes him the bottle of syrup. He takes it and puts some on his pancakes.
He eats. Mike watches.
The group is walking up the front steps of the court hous Terry joins.
Hi guys.
What are you doing here?
Dude, I'm your assistant coach. And just notice who isn't here.
Mike smiles.
Stephen Vigman.
Yeah, I got it.
Terry puts his arm on his friend's shoulder.
The whole gang is walking toward to the courtroom.
Mike?
Mike turns. Eleanor approaches.
Hi Eleanor.
Can I talk to you?
Sure.
Mike and Eleanor step to the side. She looks at Mike.
You know the transcript alone is enough to hang you.
Yeah, well, we'll see what happens.
Eleanor just looks at him, Judge and Jury. Mike blinks.
Shame on you counselor.
Is that it?
No. My client would like to talk to you.
Mike and Eleanor walk over to Cindy. She is barely holdin together.
Hi Cindy.
Hi. Is your deal still available?
Mike tries to conceal his shock.
What about Kyle?
Cindy and Eleanor share a look.
He can stay.
Then yes. It is.
And you'll send me the checks?
Every month.
You take good care of him.
We will.
Cindy nods.
I want to say goodbye.
Mike turns and waves Kyle over.
Kyle look to Jackie who gives him the OK. He walks over a Mike steps away. He just looks at his mother. She gently touches his face. He doesn't move.
Everyone looks on as Cindy says a few words to Kyle, hugs hard and then quickly turns and walks away. Kyle watches go.
A croquet ball hits a stick.
Your turn.
Abby, Kyle, and Stemler are playing on the front lawn.
I know. Don't rush me.
Stemler hits a shot and the ball goes into the garden.
This mallet is crap! You see that?
Mike pulls up and gets out of his car, wearing a suit and carrying his briefcase.
Hi guys!
Hi, Daddy. I'm winning.
What's up, coach? Hi.
That's great, honey. Kyle, can you drag those garbage cans to the side of the house for me?
Thanks, pal.
He runs inside.
Mike drops his briefcase and takes off his coat.
Hi Honey.
How was work?
Good. I got stuck at the office with a client.
Jackie walks in from the other room, gives Mike a kiss.
I know, Shelly called. Oh, I dropped off the fan at Leo's today.
Thanks for doing that.
Mike heads upstairs.
I'll be right back down.
Do you have time to eat.
I'll eat there.
Make sure you do.
Mike takes off his suit and throws it on the bed. He puts a casual button down blue shirt.
He takes a hard look himself in the mirror, almost as if steeling himself for something.
Mike smiles.
Terry walks in and crosses to the bar. He sits down.
Can I get a banana daiquiri, please?
The Bartender turns. It's Mike.
Sure.
Mike opens a beer and sets it down in front of Terry.
You want an umbrella with that?
Nah. I'm good. But keep these coming.
Mike checks a ticket and prepares two drinks.
So how you doing, pal?
Me? I'm pretty good.
We hold on Mike as he continues to work.
